{"step_by_step_thinking": "Since the pulp shows no response and there is no periapical lesion, this suggests that the tooth has become necrotic. Given the age of the fracture (10 months), it's likely that the pulp has already undergone necrosis. Therefore, a conventional root canal treatment would not be effective in this case as the pulp is non-vital. Apexification is necessary to prevent further infection and promote healing. A Ca(OH)2 pulp capping or formocresol pulpotomy would not be suitable as they are intended for vital pulp tissue.", "answer_choice": D}
